title: Fact Check: Length of National Highway Constructed Under UPA, Modi
subtitle: A viral message lists figures on length of national highway network constructed under UPA, Narendra Modi and Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
Fact: According to a report by the research wing of Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Transport (MORTH), at the end of 1981, the length of national highway network was 31,671 km.

Fact: As per the aforementioned report, in 1980, the national highway network expanded to 31,671 km. The network further expanded to 49,585 km in 1999, IndiaSpend reported, citing NHAI data which is now inaccessible. A simple subtraction results in 17,914 km.

Fact: As per IndiaSpend’s figures, the national highway network expanded from 49,585 km in 1999 to 65,569 km in 2004 which is the period when Atal Bihari Vajpayee was the Prime Minister of the country. This means that under his tenure, 15,984 km of national highway was constructed.

Fact: The UPA government ruled from 2004 to 2014. According to the annual report (2013-2014) by Ministry of Roads Transport and Highways (MORTH), the length of national highway network in 2014 was 92,851 km. Hence, the network expanded from 65,569 km in 2004 to 92,851 km in 2014. This means that in 10 years of the UPA government, an increase of 27,282 km was witnessed.
